avahi4j
Class EntryGroup

java.lang.Object
  avahi4j.EntryGroup

public class EntryGroup
extends java.lang.Object

An entry group is used to publish new services, and to update existing ones. To publish a new service:

  • Create an entry group by calling Client.createEntryGroup() on an existing Client.
  • Add one or more services by calling addService()
  • Commit the groupm which will publish the services, with commit()
Published services in a group can be updated by calling updateService(). Calling release() will unpublish all services in the group.

Author:
gilles

Method Detail

release

public void release()
This method must be called when this group is no longer needed.

commit

public int commit()
This method commits any services added to this group. If successful, the state of this group will switch to EntryGroup.State.AVAHI_ENTRY_GROUP_REGISTERING, and then to EntryGroup.State.AVAHI_ENTRY_GROUP_ESTABLISHED if the service is successfully registered.

Returns:
AVAHI_OK or one of AVAHI_ERR_* constants (see Avahi4JConstants). Note: AVAHI_ERR_COLLISION is returned if there is an existing service with the same name *

getState

public EntryGroup.State getState()
This method returns the current EntryGroup.State of this group

Returns:
the current EntryGroup.State of this group

reset

public int reset()
This method removes any previously registered services. If the group was committed, services are unregistered, and this group's state switches back to EntryGroup.State.AVAHI_ENTRY_GROUP_UNCOMMITED.

Returns:
AVAHI_OK or one of AVAHI_ERR_* constants (see Avahi4JConstants).

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
This method tests whether this group has no contents, ie no services have been added yet.

Returns:
whether this group is empty

addService

public int addService(int interfaceNum,
                      Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String domain,
                      java.lang.String host,
                      int port,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> txtRecord)
This method create a new service and adds a list of TXT records string to this group.

Parameters:
interfaceNum - the interface this service shall be announced on
proto - the protocol this service shall be announced with
name - the name for this new service (less that 63 characters, UTF8), not null
type - the type of the new service, can not be null
domain - the domain to register this service on. If null, the domain this host belongs to will be used
host - the host the service resides on. If null, the current hostname will be used
port - the port number this service runs on
txtRecord - the list of TXT records for this service (may be null)
Returns:
AVAHI_OK or one of AVAHI_ERR_* constants (see Avahi4JConstants).

addServicesubType

public int addServicesubType(int interfaceNum,
                             Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String type,
                             java.lang.String domain,
                             java.lang.String subtype)
This method adds a subtype to an existing service in this group. The service identified by interfaceNum, proto, name, type and domain must have been added (using addService() ) to this group prior to calling this method.

Parameters:
interfaceNum - the interface this service shall be announced on
proto - the protocol this service shall be announced with
name - the name for this new service (less that 63 characters, UTF8), not null
type - the type of the new service, can not be null
domain - the domain to register this service on. If null, the domain this host belongs to will be used
subtype - the new subtype to register for the specified service. not null
Returns:
AVAHI_OK or one of AVAHI_ERR_* constants (see Avahi4JConstants).

updateService

public int updateService(int interfaceNum,
                         Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String domain,
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> txtRecord)
This method updates an existing service's list of TXT records string to this group. The service identified by interfaceNum, proto, name, type and domain must have been added (using addService()) to this group prior to calling this method. Records are updated immediately, do not call commit().

Parameters:
interfaceNum - the interface this service shall be announced on
proto - the protocol this service shall be announced with
name - the name for this new service (less that 63 characters, UTF8), not null
type - the type of the new service, can not be null
domain - the domain to register this service on. If null, the domain this host belongs to will be used
txtRecord - the list of TXT records for this service (may be null)
Returns:
AVAHI_OK or one of AVAHI_ERR_* constants (see Avahi4JConstants).

findAlternativeServiceName

public static java.lang.String findAlternativeServiceName(java.lang.String collidingServiceName)
This method can be used to resolve a service name collision. It suggests a new service name which won't collide with any existing service names.

Parameters:
collidingServiceName - the service name causing the collision
Returns:
a new service name which won't collide with any existing service names.
